title: Consumer Price Index of all urban consumers , by region 2019
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) for 5 number of Countrys.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
The highest Country West has 32.57 more Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) than the lowest Country Midwest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) for 5 number of Countrys.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
The highest Country West has 32.57 more Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) than the lowest Country Midwest.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
The second highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the Country Northeast.
There is a difference of 32.57 between the maximum Country West and minimum Country Midwest.
Country West is higher than any other Countrys with value 270.35, followed by Northeast, and U.S. city average. Down to Country Midwest with the lowest value 237.78.
The lowest value 237.78 at Midwest is almost 1.06 times smaller than the average value 255.89.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 1279.45.
